info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 01 at 9:04PM MST until February 02 at 3:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Wind gusts as high as 45 mph may create areas of blowing and drifting snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, and Polebridge. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 AM MST Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult at times. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
